de.szut.dqi12.cheftrainer.server

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.szut.dqi12.cheftrainer.server.Controller

  • public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the controller class, which is very important for the start of the application. The class tries to create a connection to the database, it creates the SocketController, and the TransfermarktTimeTask.
    Author:
    Alexander Brennecke

      Constructors

      Controller()

        public Controller()

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static Controller getInstance()
        This function is used for singleton pattern.
        Returns:
        each time the same instance of a Controller object.

      • startServerSocket

        public void startServerSocket(java.lang.String packagePath,
                              java.lang.String callableDir)
        This function creates ServerProperties and with them a new SocketController. To create valid ServerProperties, it needs to map the IDs, defined in the ClientToServer_MessageIDs, to classes, which extends CallableAbstract.
        Parameters:
        packagePath - the package path of the classes, which should be mapped to the IDs
        callableDir - the director, in which the CallableAbstract classes are saved.

      • creatDatabaseCommunication

        public void creatDatabaseCommunication(boolean init)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        This function creates a new SQLConnection object and saves it in the Controller for further instructions.
        Parameters:
        sqlName - the name of the database
        sqlPath - the path to the director of the database
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when there is a database, but it is empty, and the initialization doesn't work.

      • createMatchdayFinishedTimer

        public void createMatchdayFinishedTimer(java.util.Date date,
                                        int matchDay,
                                        int season)
        Creates a MatchdayFinishedTimeTask with the given parameter
        Parameters:
        date - should be a few hours after the end of the last game of the matchday
        matchDay - the matchday (should be 1-34 for bundesliga)
        season - the season (use 2015 for 2015-2016)

      • createMatchdayStartsTimer

        public void createMatchdayStartsTimer(java.util.Date date)
        Creates a MatchdayStartsTimeTask with the given parameter
        Parameters:
        date - should be the start date of the first Match at the matchday
        matchDay - the matchday (should be 1-34 for bundesliga)
        season - the season (use 2015 for 2015-2016)

      • createMatchdayTimeTask

        public void createMatchdayTimeTask()
        This function is used, when the application starts. It fetches the next matchday from the database and creates the necessary time tasks for it.

      • newTimerTask

        public void newTimerTask()
        Creates a new TransfermarktTimeTask object, with tomorrow 1:00 am as trigger time.

      • getSQLConnection

        public SQLConnection getSQLConnection()

      • getSocketController

        public SocketController getSocketController()
